types.name: AnotherEntry
types.description:
This is just another entry to simulate that you can add facets also on JSON
schema defined types. Although you can only add documentation-based facets.

securedBy.name: custom_scheme
securedBy.description: A custom security scheme for authenticating requests.

headers.name: SpecialToken
headers.description: Used to send a custom token.

traits.name: secured
traits.usage:
This trait can be used to apply an access token query parameter
to any resources or HTTP methods.

securitySchemes.name: oauth_1_0
securitySchemes.description: OAuth 1.0 continues to be supported for all API requests, but OAuth 2.0 is now preferred.

securitySchemes.name: oauth_2_0
securitySchemes.description: Dropbox supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests.

queryParameters.name: access_token
queryParameters.description:
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with
the "Authorization" header.

headers.name: Authorization
headers.description:
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use
with the "access_token" query string parameter.

responses.description:
Bad or expired token. This can happen if the user or Dropbox
revoked or expired an access token. To fix, re-authenticate
the user.

Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired
timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

resources.description: Access to all songs inside the music world library.

securedBy.name: custom_scheme
securedBy.description: A custom security scheme for authenticating requests.

headers.name: SpecialToken
headers.description: Used to send a custom token.

body.name: application/xml
type:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
  elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
  <xs:element name="song">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="title" type="xs:string" />
        <xs:element name="artist" type="xs:string" />
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
